page.title: 12ECOLOGY - Lydham/More
page.content: One 50 yard{hedge}length contains ash, sloe, dogrose, elder, dogwood, field- maple,gooseberry,hawthorn,hazel,holly, ivy,privet, oak, rowan. Still gracing the{landscape}there are mature single and hedgerow{trees}-oak,ash,Scots pine lime, alder, sycamore. Woodburning stoves are threatening these trees. {Flora:}Shropshire Trust for Nature Conservation,in 1985, published{'The {Ecological Flora of the Shropshire {Region'}which includes the complete record of flora here. This concludes nine years of work by volunteers mainly resident in the County. Acid- loving plants grow in soils covering Basalt Rock and limelovers in the soils over{calcerous sandstones}named Pentamerus after its most numerous shell{fossils}(jokingly 'Government Rock' after shells resembling the arrowheads on Government property.)
